text.p: These are the leading stories in the Namibian press on Thursday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Namibia could lose up to 20,000 cattle, half of which are dairy cows, due to a contagious lung disease.

- Local government and housing minister, Nickey Lyamba, said decentralisation will only become a reality once regional and local authority staff are properly trained and the necessary infrastructures are in place.
- Investigations into alleged fraud and theft in Air Nambia have been concluded and the matter is to be handed over to the police, the head of Air Namibia's personnel department Mike Hill said.
